skill.name: Research Skill
skill.description: Multi-source parallel research with confidence-based synthesis.
skill.summary: Multi-source parallel research with confidence-based synthesis.
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and workflow configurations. No executable code, no direct network access, no filesystem access, no command execution. All capabilities are described as patterns for AI agents using host tool capabilities.

content.user_title: Research any topic with multi-source verification
content.value_statement: Finding accurate information takes too long when you must check multiple sources manually. This skill launches parallel research agents that search web, docs, and code simultaneously, then synthesize findings with confidence scores so you get verified answers fast.
actual_capabilities: Parallel web search using multiple query angles
Local documentation lookup in ai-docs/ directory
Three depth modes: quick, standard, extensive
Agent tagging for observability and debugging
limitations: Requires WebSearch tool availability for web research
Local docs limited to ai-docs/ and specs/ directories
Cannot access paywalled or authenticated content
Depends on AI tool's timeout and rate limit handling

use_cases.title: Find implementation patterns
use_cases.description: Search codebase and web for how to implement specific features with verified examples.

use_cases.title: Research documentation topics
use_cases.description: Gather information from web docs and local files to write accurate documentation.

use_cases.title: Quick fact verification
use_cases.description: Fast fact-checking with confidence scores to verify claims before use.

output_examples.input: /ai-dev-kit:research quick What is the TOON format?
output: **Answer**: TOON is a structured documentation format used in AI Dev Kit for organizing library documentation with hierarchies and cross-references.
**Sources**: Web search result from official docs, ai-docs/_index.toon

best_practices: Use quick mode for simple lookups and standard mode for most research tasks
Upgrade to extensive mode when comparing technologies or making architecture decisions
Review the 'Conflicting Information' section when confidence is CONFLICTING
Check source URLs and file paths to verify critical information yourself
anti_patterns: Using extensive mode for simple fact checks wastes time and resources
Accepting LOW confidence answers without verification may spread misinformation
Ignoring the 'Conflicting Information' section can lead to incorrect conclusions
Skipping source review when information will be used in production systems

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All three have WebSearch and file access tools.

faq.question: How long do research modes take?
faq.answer: Quick mode takes ~30 seconds, standard ~2 minutes, extensive ~8 minutes depending on complexity.

faq.question: Can I customize the research agents?
faq.answer: Yes, you can add custom researcher types by creating agents in agents/research/ directory.

faq.question: What data leaves my machine?
faq.answer: Only search queries are sent to web search endpoints. No personal data or files are transmitted.

faq.question: What if web search fails?
faq.answer: The skill returns available results from docs and code sources with a note about incomplete coverage.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual search?
faq.answer: Launches parallel agents so multiple sources are checked simultaneously, saving time and improving coverage.
